title: Winner of £170m EuroMillions jackpot comes forward to claim prize
text:
The video will start in 8 Cancel

Get the biggest daily news stories by email Subscribe Thank you for subscribing We have more newsletters Show me See our privacy notice Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email

A record breaking EuroMillions jackpot prize of £170 million has been paid out.

The lucky player took part in the October 8 draw and won £170,221,000 – the biggest win ever on The National Lottery.

As is their right under the lottery's rules, the winner has chosen to remain anonymous.

Andy Carter, senior winners’ advisor at The National Lottery, said: “What an amazing win – the biggest ever on The National Lottery.

"The team will now support and help guide the ticket-holder as they begin their adventure with this life changing win.

(Image: PA)

“By buying a ticket for EuroMillions or any other National Lottery game, every player is helping to raise money for good causes."

The record breaking victory came after the player matched five main number - 07, 10, 15, 44 and 49 - and the two lucky stars - 03, 12 - following the longest-ever series of rollovers.

The previous biggest UK winners were Colin and Chris Weir, from Largs in North Ayrshire, Scotland, who won £161 million in July 2011.

Adrian and Gillian Bayford, from Suffolk, took home more than £148 million in August 2012.

(Image: PA)

It has been a bumper year in terms of British winners of the EuroMillions jackpot.

In the draw on New Year’s Day, Patrick and Frances Connolly from Northern Ireland scooped a £114.9 million jackpot, followed by Ade Goodchild who banked £71 million in March.

The run of luck continued with a £38.2 million win in April and a £123 million win in June, in which both ticket-holders chose to remain anonymous.
description: The National Lottery's EuroMillions jackpot was collected by one lucky person who chose to remain anonymous
